title: Dark Mode Design
description: A showcase for good looking dark-mode websites.

title: Checklist Design
description: A useful collection of checklists on various design topics.

title: App Dissection
description: Most of the apps are redesigned but Brian's comments are still valid.

title: Humane by Design
description: A great resource on how to design more ethically humane systems.

title: Website Carbon Calculator
description: How is your website impacting the planet?

title: Andy Matuschak's working notes
description: I am amazed by the structure and the user experience. Pushing pages to the right stack looks genuine.

title: Group Chat: The Best Way to Totally Stress Out Your Team
description: How Basecamp overcomes the negatives of group chat by encouraging asyncronous communication.

title: My best products are joke
description: An article on when and how to use humor in copywriting.

title: Whereby
description: A video-conferencing app with a clean design. Works well in the web browser without any hustle and doesn't try to capture all the possible information from guests.

title: Intellectual Humility
description: An interesting read that investigates why it's hard to realize our own ignorance. The first rule of the Dunning-Kruger club is you don't know that you're a member.

title: Dense Discovery
description: My favorite weekly newsletter on technology, design and culture.

title: Tutanota
description: A conventient email service that I'm using for custom domains.

title: Chill Institute
description: A complementary torrent search service to enhance your put.io experience.

title: 7 Principles of Rich Web Applications
description: An article from Vercel's CEO Guillermo Rauch, dates back to 2014. It's fascinating to see where Next.js is now, after reading the ideological origins.
